comment: Basically Tom Garr for Real Estate. Don't take the professor for this class in the fall. Wait till the spring. You'll thank yourself later.
GOATED

The professor was great and helpful when you asked; his lectures were interesting to listen to. Graded by attendance/participation, one take-home midterm, and one final project. the midterm is easy if you listen in class and he helps if needed. The final is easy if you go to class and he is also willing to help if you ask too. Easy class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class is very easy especially with Dr.Bryant!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Class was all about lectures, little to no notes (at least for me). there is a text book but not required. Professor Bryant is a cool dude, comes with recent and real world experiences. Only grade is midterm, end of semester project, and attendance (barely). Take this if you need an easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Bryant's Commercial RE course! He was a fun professor to listen to and the class was really simple. Only grades are a midterm, final project, and attendance. Easy A and well worth taking!

I'm so glad I found this professor! The class itself is super easy (if you come to class) with nearly no note-taking needed to get an A. You'll want to come to class because the information you'll learn you will actually use the rest of your life - unlike many of your other classes. You have two exams (easy if you come to class), and a project.

He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He kept class interesting by bringing in guest speakers, and telling funny stories he could relate to the content. He wants to know his students and genuinely cares. If you take this guy you will not regret it.

Professor Bryant really cares about his students. Class is a discussion with minimal notes. 3 grades a midterm, participation, and a final project. If you show up you will get an A! I would take him again.

Bruce Bryant is probably my favorite professor that I've had in my entire college career. Bruce Bryant cares for his students, which is not something that can be said about many other professors. I learned so much in this RE class, and I am thankful for the opportunity to learn from such an intelligent and caring professor. 10/10.

He's an adjunct, knows a lot, and can teach you a few things if you are interested. But put forth any effort and all, and this is pretty much an Easy A. We had a take-home midterm and a Final Paper, but he grades very lightly (just wants to see you've tried). He's a really nice and respectful guy! Definitely a good elective class.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Take him! One of the best professors that I have had! Only two assignments: midterm and final project. The midterm is short essay questions, he gives the topics ahead of time and a week to write it. The other is a project over a piece of commercial real estate that you pick. Super easy! Class is more of a discussion than lecture.

This is a great business elective class. Only two grades all semester. One midterm paper that he gives you clear instructions on and is take home and one final project paper on a RE development- take home. You will learn a lot of info on commercial RE. Come to class as he gives participation points and will mark off if you don't attend. Speak up
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall easy class.  Material was interesting and very well presented with a real world focus.  Lots of material from current professional activities.  Professor was especially helpful as I investigated real estate software and career options and has helped me outside of the classroom in this regard.  Highly recommended.

Very nice person. You will learn real world material. Its not like your regular class. You can think of it like a seminar class. Take home two exams. Easy class. Man is very helpful. Can be funny at times. Understands business from real world perspective and not your reg book teacher. Highly recommend.

No textbook. Grade is based on a midterm essay and a final essay where you get to pick the topic. Both are take home. He doesn't really teach anything, just talks through his current deals (is a commercial lender) but it is nice to get real world examples. However, there is no real structure to the course which can be frustrating at times. Easy A.
Extremely Helpful and Nice teacher ever! He teaches you his real world experiences and very interesting. Very good entertainer and care for everyone. Very reccommend!

Entertaining instructor.  Day job as a commercial lender.  Gives you the real world; not theory.  Attending class and taking notes will make the exams a piece of cake.  Starts the class with current events - these are on the exam.  Enjoyed!
Good Teacher

Teacher is fun and interesting, has LOTS of stories and spends half of class talking about his sons, Lacross (sp), and high school/college football. He doesn't give study guides and passes current events around in class which are on tests, so you need to go or get notes from someone. Only Midterm and Final, no homework. Offers extra credit paper.
Great teacher, great class. Goes over current events for the first half of class and relates it to the content. Learned a lot about real estate and C-Stores. Recommended
